subject: Re: QS news update
msgSnippet: ... practically ... Unfortunately our use of the CMU, upon which our very souls depend at the moment, is thereby imposing rules on QS that we may or may not
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, John Cowan <cowan@...> wrote:
>
> I note that CMU does not merge D and T between vowels, though
practically
> everybody in North America does. It's artificial, all right, but for
> our purposes that's useful.
>

Unfortunately our use of the CMU, upon which our very souls depend at
the moment, is thereby imposing rules on QS that we may or may not
want. In this case the CMU has created the rule "spell all Ts with
#3Tea even if you pronounce them as Day". This rule is not in the QM
and was not thought out by anyone re:QS, but is a side effect of using
the CMU. It may turn out to be a good rule I can't say; it is
certainly worth threshing out. But we really should not just inherit
rules from the CMU without investigation.
